subject: RE: covid info banner - sargodo site
preview: Hi Brittany,Sure, we have updated the popup. Let me know if this works for you? https://sargoodoncollaroy.com/I have cleared the site cache as well.

full_threads.body:
Hi Brittany,

Sure, we have updated the popup. Let me know if this works for you? https://sargoodoncollaroy.com/
I have cleared the site cache as well.

Thanks Joel that's great 😊

Sorry just one more question for you - we were asked to add all that content to the pop up that sits on the home page and the book now page, and the bullet points after the first paragraph aren't aligning correctly.



Would you be able to have a quick look at that for us?

Thanks so much!

Brittany Tudela

Marketing Specialist

Sargood on Collaroy | 1 Brissenden Avenue, Collaroy NSW 2097

t: +61 2 9808 9602 | m: 0466 668 276 | e: brittany.tudela@sargoodoncollaroy.com.au |

w: www.sargoodoncollaroy.com



BRITTANY TUDELA​

MARKETING SPECIALIST

D.

+61 2 9808 9602

M.
0466 668 276

E.
Brittany.Tudela@royalrehab.com.au

Hi Brittany,

Confirming we have updated the below. Cheers!

@joel on sargoodoncollaroy.com - can you please centre the top toolbar covid message which says: READ OUR COVID-19 SAFETY MEASURES

And then let the client know the below has been done (I have updated the rest). Thanks!!

Thanks Heath!

Could ‘read our COVID measures’ be centred on the ribbon rather than on the side?

Could we also add the following highlighted copy to the page, so the page reads as so:

Sargood on Collaroy continues to monitor developments, take precautionary measures and strictly follow the guidelines of relevant authorities including the NSW Ministry of Health with regard to COVID-19. The health and wellbeing of our guests and staff members is our top priority. Please read the important information below. To maximize safety for all during this period, some of our services are temporarily suspended or replaced with telehealth (digital alternatives to face-to-face sessions). Please feel free to contact us if we can be of any assistance.

Please do not visit our facility if:

You feel unwell in any way,
You have been in or through Victoria in the last 14 days,
You have been to locations within South Australia or New Zealand where you were instructed to self-isolate and get testing in the last 14 days. South Australian locations can be found here https://tinyurl.com/y64ap3qe <https://tinyurl.com/y64ap3qe>. New Zealand locations can be found here https://tinyurl.com/y5w7fthf <https://tinyurl.com/y5w7fthf>.
You have been to any of the locations or travelled on nominated public transport routes, during the time and date indicated, in the “Self-isolate and get tested immediately if you’ve been to these locations” or “Monitor for symptoms if you’ve been to these locations” or “Public transport routes” tables at NSW Government – Latest news and updates.
You have travelled internationally in the last 14 days,
You have visited any of the NSW hotspots as identified on the Australian Government website https://www.nsw.gov.au/covid-19/latest-news-and-updates <https://www.nsw.gov.au/covid-19/latest-news-and-updates>,
If you have a member of the family who in the last 14 days has been in or through Victoria, or travelled internationally, or to any of the hotspots, and you assist them with daily tasks,
You have been in contact with anyone with a confirmed or suspected case of COVID-19.
You are under 16 years of age.

Guests visiting Sargood on Collaroy must practice the following precautions:

Wear a face mask (a cloth mask is suitable). After putting it on to cover your nose and mouth, do not touch the front of the mask and remove it using the ear loops or head straps. Dispose of the mask into a waste bin and perform hand hygiene with soap and water or alcohol hand rub.
Practice social distancing – stay 1.5 metres from others.
Cough and sneeze into your elbow.
Regularly use hand sanitizer which is available throughout our facility.
Conditions of stay:
Please note: we are currently taking bookings up to 31 March 2021.
Guests must pre-book their stays
Stays available for Friday – Thursday night booking windows
Min 3 night, Max 7 night stays
All guests to be screened prior to, and upon arrival to Sargood on Collaroy, including having their temperature checked
Clients from recognised COVID-19 hotspots, close contacts of confirmed COVID-19 cases or those showing any symptoms are not able stay
If any guest develops symptoms during their stay, they will have to have a COVID test, and return home with accompanying travellers immediately
No cancellation fee for any unused night in the case of illness
Guests may use their own carers, but only if they stay onsite
All guests and staff to be wearing face masks outside of guest room when onsite at Sargood on Collaroy, during care and during any outdoor recreation activity when supported by Sargood staff

That should be all!
Thank you 😊
Brittany Tudela
Marketing Specialist

Sargood on Collaroy | 1 Brissenden Avenue, Collaroy NSW 2097

On 20 Nov 2020, at 3:23 pm, Brittany Tudela <Brittany.Tudela@Royalrehab.com.au <mailto:Brittany.Tudela@Royalrehab.com.au>> wrote:

Thanks Heath!
Could we also add the following information:

Guest restrictions at Sargood on Collaroy
Please do not visit our facility if:
You feel unwell in any way,
You have been in or through Victoria in the last 14 days,
You have been to locations within South Australia or New Zealand where you were instructed to self-isolate and get testing in the last 14 days. South Australian locations can be found here https://tinyurl.com/y64ap3qe <https://tinyurl.com/y64ap3qe>. New Zealand locations can be found here https://tinyurl.com/y5w7fthf <https://tinyurl.com/y5w7fthf>.
You have been to any of the locations or travelled on nominated public transport routes, during the time and date indicated, in the “Self-isolate and get tested immediately if you’ve been to these locations” or “Monitor for symptoms if you’ve been to these locations” or “Public transport routes” tables at NSW Government – Latest news and updates.
You have travelled internationally in the last 14 days,
You have visited any of the NSW hotspots as identified on the Australian Government website https://www.nsw.gov.au/covid-19/latest-news-and-updates <https://www.nsw.gov.au/covid-19/latest-news-and-updates>,
If you have a member of the family who in the last 14 days has been in or through Victoria, or travelled internationally, or to any of the hotspots, and you assist them with daily tasks,
You have been in contact with anyone with a confirmed or suspected case of COVID-19.
You are under 16 years of age.
Guests visiting Sargood on Collaroy must practice the following precautions:
Wear a face mask (a cloth mask is suitable). After putting it on to cover your nose and mouth, do not touch the front of the mask and remove it using the ear loops or head straps. Dispose of the mask into a waste bin and perform hand hygiene with soap and water or alcohol hand rub.
Practice social distancing – stay 1.5 metres from others.
Cough and sneeze into your elbow.
Regularly use hand sanitizer which is available throughout our facility.
And can we have the ribbon text and page title changed to: Read our COVID-19 safety measures

Thank you!

Brittany Tudela
Marketing Specialist

Thanks very much 😊
Britt
